website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight, versatile, and expertly constructed speakers that won't break your budget.
pros: Edgy design allows speakers to stand out in any living space
Compact size ensures the speakers can deliver exceptional audio without using too much space
Comes with a convenient headphone jack for private listening
Offers a built-in knob so you can easily adjust the volume

customer_reviews.title: RETURN to amazon if its packed in plastic bag!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these s120 speakers as new and when i received them they were packaged in a plastic bag. There were no instructions and the serial number was blacked out with a black marker. In addition, these speakers did not even work. No power light came on. Logitech does not sell these speakers bulk packaged like this. If you received this in the plastic bag like this, immediately return to amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Great User

customer_reviews.title: never buy crappy computer speakers always spend a little bit more money
customer_reviews.text: I bought the cheap computer speakers and I regret it the things have virtually no bass and sound like absolute ridiculousness. I replace the cheap Logitech speakers with this more expensive model for just $10 more. for the most part in this world you get exactly what you pay for. spending 10 extra dollars save me a world of stress. also the cords are too short and it's hard to reach around my computer monitor. whoever invented these ridiculous speakers should be imprisoned for making such a bad product.
customer_reviews.author: Preston Garvey

customer_reviews.title: Failure after 60 days
customer_reviews.text: First time I've ever had a problem with any logitech product so I'm going to consider this an anomaly considering the many different devices I've purchased from the company. Worked fine for two months but now the speakers are back-feeding voltage into the computer. With speakers plugged in and powered up, computer won't boot. Motherboard alarms sounds long, repeated "beep" during P.O.S.T.. Unplug speaker jack, computer boots normally. Plug in different speakers, computer boots normal. Cheap speakers and I should have known better. Not worth the postage to return them. Save yourself the trouble, time and possible costly repairs. Avoid this model.
customer_reviews.author: John D

customer_reviews.title: Lots of crackling and background noise
customer_reviews.text: Less than impressed with these speakers. The sound quality when not crackling and some type of background noise isn't there is good, but most of the time there is crackling and some scratchy background noise 75% of the time. Thought maybe it was just the audio jack on my pc, but it does this on multiple devices (other pc, laptop, and phone). Have bought logitech in the past with no problems, hence why I didn't hesitate to purchase these speakers. Definitely disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.author: Richard L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Best $10 I ever spent...
customer_reviews.text: For only $10 I mean come on! I just needed a set of speakers for a laptop in a guest room because you can't hear the laptop speakers very well. These speakers are more than powerful enough! No, they do not have any bass and no, they won't make any audiophile happy. That being said, the amplification is great, even at medium volume they are quite loud. Totally fit the bill and solved the problem. Crystal clear sound, no distortion or crackling or hissing even at full volume.
customer_reviews.author: TINETQL

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for Office Set-up
customer_reviews.text: For starters, these are not Bose or Beats or any other high-end speakers. But, they are a GREAT value for the price. I bought these primarily for an office setting to listen to webinars, news clips and some light youtube listening. They are clear, do not take up a lot of desk space, have ample cord length (both for the power cord and speaker wire) and are aesthetically pleasing. I do recommend these but not for the audio aficionado. Yes, there's an annoying red light but you can cover it with a section of a post-it colored black with a sharpie.
customer_reviews.author: Randy K.

customer_reviews.title: These little guys ROCK!
customer_reviews.text: I needed small-space desk speakers for basic sound (system notifications, human speech, the occasional YouTube anthem) on my monitor, not audiophile-quality blasters, and I'm not really into bass quality for that purpose. These speakers are perfect for what I bought them for, and even do well with real music. I can't speak to their long-term durability, since I've only had them since early this year, but I've never found a bad Logitech product yet. Their only fault is that the compact black-monolith design is a little easy to tip over, but careful owners should have no problems.
customer_reviews.author: M K Temple

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly small but work surprisingly well
customer_reviews.text: When I received these the box was so small I thought I must have made a mistake for ordering speakers this small. However, they work flawlessly and look just fine to me. I don't listen to music. I use them just for watching news on my PC and for Netflix and YouTube occasionally. They're all I needed. The only thing I didn't like was they have a 110 Volt power supply that needs to plug into the wall. It would have been better if they got their power from a USB connection on the PC. They wouldn't be good for a laptop for some people because of the power requirement.
customer_reviews.author: Sailor Mon

customer_reviews.title: Lackluster in all ways
customer_reviews.text: In the description, they say the dimensions are: 11.46 x 20 x 7.24 inches. That is not the speakers but the box it comes in. If you like that annoying electronic buzzing or "amp" hum these speakers are for you! Because they do it ALL THE TIME! The sound is full of a "tinny" (tinny, I mean that it has an irritating, high-pitched shrieking quality) You can clearly see in the photo they are only the size of a soda can. Not worth the 8.49 dollars I spent on them. A massive lack of quality even for a cheap speaker. You would be better off without the sound coming out of these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTED!!!
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE BUZZING WHEN FULLY INSERTED INTO LAPTOP--HAD TO JIGGLE IT OUT A BIT TO STOP THE BUZZING. STILL A LITTLE STATIC-Y AND HURTING MY HEAD TO LISTEN. I HAVE HAD SUCCESSFUL LOGITECH PURCHASES IN THE PAST, BUT THESE ARE JUST WRONG, WRONG, WRONG. I WISH I WOULD HAVE SEEN THE MANY, MANY REVIEWS ABOUT THE BUZZING SOUND BEFORE I MADE THIS PURCHASE. WASTED MY TIME AND MONEY. If you check my other reviews, I am nearly 100% positive. I have never given this low of a rating, ever. Why are they continuing to sell a faulty product?
customer_reviews.author: PalliNurse

customer_reviews.title: No bass. Works perfectly, tho.
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars because they work perfectly fine. However, my personal dislikes are they are really, really small. I wasn't paying close enough attention to the dimensions. When I saw how little they were I cracked up laughing. The sound is primarily vocal. The bass is fairly non-existent. But they're clear. No flaws or malfunctions. They work perfectly. I just wish they were about 2in taller and had a richer bass sound. Or any bass at all, for that matter. Hah!
customer_reviews.author: Burgh

customer_reviews.title: Junk, don't bother
customer_reviews.text: These are junk. Spend a little more and get something good. I needed some speakers for our dot because the dot has terrible sound quality. The first set I got only one speaker produced sound through the dot and there was a popping and crackle in it. Ordered a replacement and once again, only one speaker worked and it only did so for a few hours. We turned it off and went to turn it back on and nothing. So back they went. It was a total waste of time. I should have just bought something better to start with. We are now loving our sound in our anke speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Seattlerain

customer_reviews.title: good price, works ok
customer_reviews.text: these speakers are just the right size! they work okay. my left speaker is perfect! the sound works perfectly and the volume can easily be adjusted. my right speaker, however, seems to barely work. i dont know if this is just how the product is made or if my right speaker is just flawed. i thought it didn't work the first time i bought it, but i did a sound check on it and it's just super quiet. frankly, if the two speakers were not connected, i would have just tossed the right speaker because it is pretty much useless. my left speaker, however, is perfect! great, clear, and loud. for the price, i think this product is worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Good little speaker for the price
customer_reviews.text: Can't completely give five stars yet. But cost versus working. Good deal. Changed my monitor out that had speakers to a monitor that does not have speakers. That's why I bought these. Don't need to sound great but they did need to have a headphone jack. The sound is ok. I like to record LPs to the computer. And I have neighbors so the headphones work the best. They are shielded so you can put them right next to the monitor with no problem. They are small that is good. Little top-heavy cuz base is a little on the small side, but given the size of the speakers I guess that's normal.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen S

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes glitchy, but overall good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my computer. I couple times they have seemed to sort of short out and start making a static noise, but troubleshooting it led me to updating my drive and rebooting, which seemed to work. Aside from that happening a couple times and making me think they might be faulty, for the most part they have great sound quality that's easy to adjust or turn off with a knob which is nicer than having to use the computer to turn up or down sound. I use them for music or skype calls and the quality of sound is great. I do wish the cords were longer and not so awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Deal
customer_reviews.text: I have had it with over paying for BOSE products. These little suckers are they best buy online. I wish they had a drop more base but at this price I am really not complaining. I got the S120 model because it has a touch more power but they are not USB powered they are old fashioned plug it. I also like this model because it has a simple one knob set up for power and volume. I hope, of course, that they last for ever but for the quality and price I would be happy if they last a couple of years. (again, I wish they had a drop more base) Totally 100% recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Voigt

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my otherwise awesome HDTV sound
customer_reviews.text: Whenever I watched a DVD or Blu-Ray the sound was so disproportional between voices and sound effects I was having to crank it up to understand what was being said, which made the sound effects painfully loud. Sound output via the headset jack is more carefully modulated to avoid hearing damage, so I figured speakers plugged in there would give a more leveled out sound experience. Bingo. Problem solved - and cheaply too! FYI I covered the obnoxious orange light with a bit of scotch tape and blacked it out with a Sharpie. Electrical tape would do as well.
customer_reviews.author: Carma

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Gets a 1 star because they barely gave out any sound. I pre bought this for my son's new pc that was being built & coming on the mail. As a result, i waited longer than anticipated for the pc due to covid, and it was too late to return the speakers. This was my 2nd time buying these and the first time had no issue. But this order, there was barely any sound coming out. Went through all settings, sound cards, even tried on different computers, and they were trash. Was 100% satisfied with my first order a year ago, and these were just garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Cheap Speakers - Perfect for Classroom
customer_reviews.text: For $10 speakers, these are perfect and work well. I bought them for my classroom, so the sound quality was not a key factor for me. I honestly don't really pay close attention to things like that so I can't speak on the sound quality of them. But they are cheap and they are sturdy, which is exactly what I needed from a pair of speakers. They get quite well and it's easy to quickly control the volume, which is important to me as a teacher. The cords that connect them are sort of weirdly spaced. But they definitely left me plenty of room to maneuver the speakers as needed near my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Slacker5001

customer_reviews.title: good sound
customer_reviews.text: For inexpensive speakers and if you don't need sound that is the sound of Bose, these are for you. I got them for my travel speakers and I love them. They have great sound and do a grat job for the money. I don't know of any other speakers that have as good of quality as these for the size. I have 2 pairs of these and I would buy another pair if one of these die. I heard some speakers of this size that really sound terrible, but these sound like quality speakers and they have the power supply internal which is a plus to me. Everything is like Logitech Quality!!! A+++ SOLID
customer_reviews.author: Battlehawk43

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I have an expensive headset, but wanted something just to listen to music with. These work just fine, but they don't have great audio depth. They do get very very loud though, I barely have them turned up at all. My only real "issue" with them is that sometimes when left on they start making crackling/static sounds so I just turn them off when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Artist Kate

customer_reviews.title: For the price and size, these are actually really good speakers
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite of my many sets of cheap computer speakers. Considering their price point and their size, they put out some really good sound. I also like that they run on wall power AC (instead of USB). I think too many manufacturers are relying on USB power (which is hard on the computer's motherboard), and this doesn't. I also like the built-in headphone jack - which comes in convenient when I'm trying not to disturb others.
customer_reviews.author: Photographer James Falkofske

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.text: My 20 year old speakers finally bit the dust, victims of my cats throwing them onto the floor repeatedly. These speakers aren't bad for the price. I watch movies, sometimes listen to music, and they're fine for that. Nothing special, certainly not sound-system level, but they work fine. Obnoxious orange light that I covered with electrician's tape. Big drawback is the short cords -- they both have to be on the right side of my monitor because the cords won't stretch to have one right and one left. But that's minor for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Miller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price point
customer_reviews.text: Recently built a PC and was trying to cut corners where I could to keep the price down- figured I'd go for these speakers since I use a headset most of the time anyway and why waste money on stuff you dont use all that much? But lo and behold, the sound quality on these little suckers is phenomenal. Obviously these aren't for audiophiles or people looking to get serious audio quality but if you just need a set of desktop speakers I can't recommend these any higher. Great sound quality, super freakin' cheap, the LED is quite bright though and the wires might leave your desk feeling cluttered. 4/5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S

customer_reviews.title: With My Laptop, Not Loud Enough to Be Heard by a Classroom
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed that these speakers could not deliver enough sound from my laptop, which may provide a weak audio signal, to fill a classroom, which was their intended use. I can't help thinking that speakers with their own AC power plug should be able to crank the sound up pretty good, even though I don't expect small ones to provide much base. I don't need them to play great music, though, I need them loud enough so narration can be heard. I have another use for them, and don't intend to return them, but will have to try again.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent DiCarlo

customer_reviews.title: Good Construction, but minimalist computer speaker
customer_reviews.text: There is no bass in these speakers period. I think they will work nicely for voice sound on the computer, but they are only marginal for music. The good news is that they are cheap, and the transformer is not on the end of power cord, so you can plug into an outlet or strip and use the plug beside it! I do not recommend this item unless you can't afford to spend an additional $10 to get something worth a crap. They are much smaller than I thought they would be, which is also why they have zero bass.
customer_reviews.author: Pignutr

customer_reviews.title: Decent small speakers!
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful small speakers! It has been a total night and day difference between these and the 4 dollar Daiso shop mini USB speakers that I bought about a week ago. Those died on me, and I needed new ones quickly. This particular set of speakers fit the bill nicely. The stereo that comes out of it is, while not audiophile worthy, it is quite good for a cheap set of speakers. As long as you aren't expecting these to sound like 100+dollar counterparts, then these deliver rather impressive volume and sound for the price point. Quite pleased. If these ever die on me in the future, I would highly consider getting another set of them.
customer_reviews.author: sakura_yuna

customer_reviews.title: Work as described
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a sound booster for an old 25 years TV analog. I selected the logitech pour une connection non usb It does the job perfectly . The sound is surprisingly good for voice/news etc I can now wait a little to replace the TV, Very simple plug into the Tv with a little adapter ,plug into the outlet. The sound can be adjusted on the speakers and with the TV"s remote. for a cost under 20$ The commentaries on Amazon help me in making a decision.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after two weeks
customer_reviews.text: I plugged these speakers in at first, and instantly had bad sound. Scratchy noise with one speaker not working. I started the return process, however based on reviews, I read that if it was plugged directly into an outlet and not an extension cord that it would resolve the issues. It did at first. I canceled the return and kept them. When they're working, they offer strong sound at an affordable price. Sadly to say, after one week of being plugged into a wall outlet, they are demonstrating the same defects. Scratchy sounds and one speaker not working again. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got these for my granny
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for your PC. My grandma complained because her PC wouldn't play her YouTube videos loud enough. So we got these for under 15 bucks and she is so impressed. So if you're an average-Joe PC user in search of some extra volume, I would totally recomend these. They're nothing special, but they're easy to install and definitely do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Devan

customer_reviews.title: LIKE 'EM
customer_reviews.text: I needed new speakers for my computer and bought these. The price was right and the volume allows me to turn them up loud enough to be heard from my bedroom when I'm in the kitchen 30 feet away. I'm not an audiophile, so I can't really speak knowledgeably about the bass quality, but it's fine for me. I'm quite happy with them. They're easy to dust off and clean with a rag when necessary and they take up very little space on my desk beside my monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: nice speakers for my computer good price too
customer_reviews.text: the speakers i had for my computer bit the dust after only a short time after purchasing them from a box store, but i am very happy that i ordered these speakers they work great the volume on them is really great, and i like the size of them they fit perfectly on my desk, and fingers crossed hopefully these speaks will last longer then the other more expensive ones i only lasted me 4 months---these seam to be holding up great sense i bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice speakers- Questionable Wiring
customer_reviews.text: The speakers are fine and I would have given them a 5 star review but someone wasn't thinking when they did the wiring. They put the power cord (yes these speakers require 120 volts) and the USB cord on different speakers. If they had of put the power cord and USB cord on the same speaker you could be allot more versatile in the speaker. So rather than having to have only one speaker close to the back of the computer you have to have both speakers close to the computer to plug them in...makes no sense to me.
customer_reviews.author: triedntrue

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap 🔊
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality on the speakers is good. They're great for computer speakers and I would recommend them for that. They do get quite loud and that's a good thing. There's no feedback or odd crackling when you turn the volume up to a the loudest setting. You do have to plug the speakers into the audio jack and a wall plug. Both wires are sufficiently long enough if you have your computer on the floor with a standard desk height.
customer_reviews.author: FireWitch1

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent pair of speakers for the price. For this price ($8.49), I give it a 5-star rating. The dimensions mentioned under description can be somewhat misleading, unless it is for the package in which these speakers are shipped. The actual dimensions of the speakers are about 6.5" (height) x 2.5" (width - sideways) x 2" (length - front to back). Sound is also reasonably loud.
customer_reviews.author: Arun

customer_reviews.title: Decent Little Speakers
customer_reviews.text: For the price I have no complaints. They work great to get more stereo sound from my laptop when using it at home. I got the 120 VAC powered version because it doesn't tie up a USB port, and they probably can put out more volume being AC powered. The size is good too as they don't take up much space. Like the metal grills vs speakers with cloth grills. The sound is a decent mix of treble and bass ... good for not having any treble or bass adjustment. No static at all on the set I received ... clear sound output.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Ive owned a set for a very long time (1.0), never had an issue. Im sure these 2.0s will be on par. Sound is acceptable for $10, there are definitely worse speakers out there. They are great when you need a small set of speakers that dont sound totally horrible and need a 3.5mm stereo jack plug (the headphone jack on the control speaker is handy as well). Will work on literally anything that has a headphone jack or 3.5mm output, just need power (wall socket). Dont expect spectacular sound or much bass, what are you expecting to get for $10?
customer_reviews.author: Eric C.

customer_reviews.title: Good product good price
customer_reviews.text: I mean guys for the price this is unbeatable, they're Logitech, they have like a 2 year hardware support warranty, they're powered so they're very loud and yeah I mean for what you paid you're not going to get better sound. I mean sure they're not super surround sound with woofer speakers but for what they are and their price you cannot go wrong. I definitely recommend and would definitely buy again if I needed just normal computer speakers.
customer_reviews.author: R. DeLozier

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars because of the price and convenience
customer_reviews.text: Oftentimes when online shopping, you get what you pay for. however, if you need an inexpensive solution to get audible music, sound for videos, web-based classes or training, or just general household computer use, theses speakers perform well and they are easy on the wallet. I set these up in my office and now I'm able to demonstrate product videos to customers, complete online training easily, complete video production with attention paid to sound clarity, and even listen to music in the background while I work. These speakers are not for music producers or audiophiles. However, I affirm my 5 star rating as they are the best, cheap speakers the average Joe can buy.
customer_reviews.author: Dubjay03

customer_reviews.title: Price is great, quality of sound not so.
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Volume is good way more than adequate for computer speakers. The problem is the quality of sound. The sound clarity and quality are much to be desired. For normal computer work these speakers are fine but if you are going to use it a lot for listening to music or some other audio stuff, I would seek a better set of speakers. But again, what can you get for under $9! So, I recommend the product conditionally.
customer_reviews.author: gadgetnut

customer_reviews.title: Extension Cord May Be Required
customer_reviews.text: I got these because my little 2in1 laptop/tablet doesn’t have powerful speakers, especially when I am several feet away to work out while watching YouTube videos, these do their job just fine, but the wires are weird, the wires to plug in and separate the speakers are the same length as the plug, which is a problem, I almost thought that I would have to get an extension cord before I found another on the other side that is JUST long enough to go that way, you may want an extension cord
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Meares

customer_reviews.title: its a great value for the small low power niche
customer_reviews.text: These are low priced, small speakers meant to be portable or take up a small amount of space. As such they perform this function admirably. If you are looking for home theater speakers, look elsewhere. These small speakers are clear and low noise granting me sound output for a Raspberry Pi. No subwoofer or even woofer so poor bass but it was a great value for the small low power niche. I am quite satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Al C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These Logitech speakers are just what we needed. Simple, good-looking, well constructed and a good size. Sound great. Made by a company that has been doing this a long time. Flexible and easy to set-up. Note these connect via a cord with "headset" jacks at each end. They aren't bluetooth. My daughter wanted these for an MP3 player she uses at her workstation in the kitchen where she works. Couldn't ask for better. And, for the price, she doesn't feel anxious about possible kitchen mishaps.
customer_reviews.author: RogerS

customer_reviews.title: They're actually really impressive
customer_reviews.text: I got these just for my girlfriend's school-from-home setup and they're actually really really good. Great sound quality and bass, nice size, a simple audio jack and powercord setup. They're good. I'd definitely recommend. They seem durable, too
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: My original speakers came from a previous job- my bosses were replacing the sound system and said I could have the old speakers. The sound on the old speakers was awesome! My cats chewed through the speaker cord, so I bought these based on the reviews. I don't know what the reviewers were listening to.... certainly not these!! I will definitely have to replace these!! Super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: sandi street

customer_reviews.title: Discrete, small, and great sound!
customer_reviews.text: I got these to tuck discretely in the bottom corners of my lower shelf on my plant area in the kitchen. I like to play relaxing gentle music at a low volume so that you don't hear it from the other rooms, but if you walk into the kitchen there's just a calm atmosphere with my plants and music. These work great! I hooked them up to a little portable CD player, and plugged both into the wall and tucked the cords behind the table. You don't notice them, but they are great sound quality!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Equal to competitors but half the price.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to purchase these due to some of the reviews. I’m glad I purchased them. They are perfect for my needs! They sound good! I watch a lot of YouTube videos to learn things and these are perfect! The price was very reasonable and I don’t think the more expensive ones would have been any better. I also own a set of Bose on another computer and these are similar to those for much less.
customer_reviews.author: dronecrazy

customer_reviews.title: Great product and a real bargain.
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect desktop speakers for my chromebook. I am 65 years old, a little hard of hearing and very low tech. I needed something to help me when the built in chromebook speaker wasn't enough and also that would be easy to plug in. Not only did these fill the bill, but the price was sweet. Thank you to all the other reviewers who helped me find these amongst the many other choices.
customer_reviews.author: StopDiabetes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect small speakers
customer_reviews.text: I really hate all this equipment that needs a USB source for power. I have enough plugged into my computer as it is. I bought these speakers specifically because they plug into a power supply. No USB. I wanted a set of speakers in my bedroom and the sound is great, plenty of volume for what I need them for, and one can't beat the price. Lots of other expensive choices. These are recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MadMax

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe I almost spent over $100 on speakers.
customer_reviews.text: I have had these and been using them for several months. I don't listen to much music, but I think it's probably fine for that. Not sure what else to say, other than that they do the job. I use them for watching Twitch and YouTube, and they work fine. I bought my husband $100 Bose speakers, and I am so glad I got these affordable ones for me because the performance is VERY similar.
customer_reviews.author: MaryWHicks13

customer_reviews.title: They work...
customer_reviews.text: These are cheap, and super light weight. Its the cables attached to them are heavier as these constantly fall on their sides from the weight of the cables pulling them down. The 3.5mm cable is shorter than I would like, and hard wired to the speaker, so you would need to get an extension cable to get it further. Its attached to the right speaker, so if your case is tucked away to the left, it might not reach.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: One flaw in good speakers
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these I have purchased the first pair I loaned to someone and never got them back.They are good speakers in that they volume is much louder than other speakers I have used but the connection to the computer keeps falling out and I have to plug it back in. I am still trying to get them to work well with my computer but I still like them a lot
customer_reviews.author: Chef Christensen

customer_reviews.title: You won't find better for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: Basic computer speakers, fantastic quality for the price. Seriously was floored by their sound delivery. The sound is clear, full bodied, and the adjustment dial is smooth with great range. These speakers are fantastic if you're looking for some good casual listening. Obviously, these aren't for studio/professional quality sound... So don't expect that level.
customer_reviews.author: Nik Dizzle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I stopped using my JAMS and other Bluetooth speakers over this. Yeah, it still has a wire... but who cares? The bass, volume and quality is really great for an apartment, small living space. Plug it into the wall and the other end into your smartphone and that's all you need. When I'd use Bluetooth ones before, they'd drain fast, even after fully charged. You can also always get an extension cord for the 3.5mm jack on amazon for as long as you want.
customer_reviews.author: 180MovieDOTcom

customer_reviews.title: High pitched noise at all times
customer_reviews.text: I originally gave these five stars but they've since begun to make a high pitched sound at all times. If they're plugged in, they're screeching, whether or not the power is switched to on. It's very hard on my ears. I may end up settling for no speakers at all until I find a replacement, that's how bad these things are.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: just fine for Mother to have sound from videos on Facebook and Youtube
customer_reviews.text: These are basic speakers. Probably not great for gaming or watching feature length block busters, but just fine for Mother to have sound from videos on Facebook and Youtube. They're small, unobtrusive and don't take up more than their share of a power strip with some huge transformer brick. They do occasionally have a slight hum, but I think it's just interference from the cordless phone base being too close to them.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Genuinely didn't expect too much. I just wanted something that wouldn't clip with basic audio. But I will say I'm blown away by these. The quality is extremely useable and has never given me any issues in any situation. It's certainly not top level audio by any means, but if you want something that will give you a decent, TV grade sound, this is the best value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Chase

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for basic sound from computer
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed. Very good basic computer speakers. Small footprint. Not extremely loud, but enough volume. I like that they use a regular AC power cord instead of a wall wart. If you're looking for thick thumpy bass, you'll want to get something else. But if all you want is basic, clear sound for general listening from your computer, these work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: t-d-h

customer_reviews.title: If all you need is sound...
customer_reviews.text: this is perfect. If you are an audiophile, why are you looking at these $8 speakers? I just needed something to hear all my YouTube DIY videos. These are perfect for that purpose. I also play music as background noise and can tell how bad these are for music. But then all I want from these is BACKGROUND noise. So they're 5 star for my intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Vic

customer_reviews.title: Very good computer speakers for the price
customer_reviews.text: We needed replacement speakers when the ones we had stopped working after about 4 years. Although very inexpensive, these speakers had decent reviews, and we ordered them. Installation was a breeze, because they are "plug and play" using the PC's external speaker jack and the A/C power plug-in that comes with the speakers. Although the sound has relatively little bass, it is more than adequate for Zooming, playing videos, and light listening to Internet sources.
customer_reviews.author: Daktam

customer_reviews.title: Great for my MP3 player
customer_reviews.text: I got these speakers to use with my MP3 player at night, because I was tired of buying those little “capsule” usb speakers. These speakers are small enough to sit on my tiny night table, has an off/on - volume control knob, a cable to plug into my MP3 player, and a VERY bright orange LED light - at least it's not blue or green! I've got a couple labels over the LED to dim it down a little. For the small size, off/on - volume control knob, and decent sound, I give these speakers 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: GH

customer_reviews.title: Great set of speakers for under $10
customer_reviews.text: Great set of speakers for under $10. The volume knob is very responsive, although a bit harder to turn on than one would expect (Not a big deal and maybe even a good thing). Only bad thing in my opinion are that these speakers are very light. I have mine on the dresser to listen while falling alseep and they could easily be knocked off if by the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Cassiedle

customer_reviews.title: They're good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not full 5 starts but for the price (less than ten bucks) I think this is a good purchase. My monitor didn't come with speakers and it was annoying to have to put headphones on every time I needed to hear something. The volume goes pretty loud but at the louder levels there's distortion. The engineers should have considered limiting how far the knob can turn. Otherwise the speakers are good.
customer_reviews.author: Sosv

customer_reviews.title: worse than expected
customer_reviews.text: very small and flimsy speakers. very light so they keep falling over, so unstable that likely will fall over just tring to adjust volume or slight tug of wires. sound is just ok for even such small cheap speakers, barely an upgrade from my pad or phone speakers. Logitech has far better speakers for only a few dollars more, these were a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, sounds great!
customer_reviews.text: I had super old computer speakers that finally died. My hubby picked these out for me and all I did was plug them into the audio jack where the old ones had been, plugged them into the power and SOUND!!! And really nice crisp clear sound!!! I like that they have a volume control on the speakers themselves and the sound for me is phenomenal. I am NOT a techie or very sound savvy, but these sound crisp and clear and when I stream videos, they work well.
customer_reviews.author: Blueroads

customer_reviews.title: Good For The Money
customer_reviews.text: They say you get what you pay for, and for what I paid (less than $9 out the door) these are good little speakers. If you're looking for deep bass and rich sound, these speakers won't fit the bill. But If you just want some no frills sound to come out of your desktop computer or laptop for a cheap price, then get these. Even listening to music is halfway pleasant with these, but not amazing. I just got them so there's no telling how long they'll last, but if your most important factor is price then these are the speakers for you.
customer_reviews.author: T. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Basic speakers
customer_reviews.text: I recently moved and the cable for a set of quality speakers had gone missing (later found in box containing bathroom items in a completely different part of the house, pretty sure this is how movers amuse themselves), and I have a lot of live meetings, so I needed something that worked and quick. This served their purpose, I do still use them, but I don't use them for sound quality, just sound in general.
customer_reviews.author: Liz C

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Nice tone for computer speakers! I wasn't expecting much due to the reviews, but was happy with the fast shipping because I had destroyed my "Insignia" speakers trying to make them work for a player that kicked the bucket anyway. The only thing I miss is that the Insignia speakers had a separate bass player, nice for rock music. Anyway, these sound good, and have more depth than I expected. I haven't used them for music yet, but playing EQ2, they sound great, and being on a budget, just what I need! I also bought a second set
customer_reviews.author: L. Rockhold

customer_reviews.title: Horrible speakers, do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I will be returning these soon. I hate them. They are small and compact, which I like, but the thick cord on the back of the right speaker makes it impossible for the speaker to stand on its own. Also, if you have the volume turned down low or extremely high, you get a constant buzz/hiss through the speakers. There's only a small spectrum of the volume you can have it turned to to not get any buzz or hiss at all. Cheap quality. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stoneking

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: These work for what I wanted. Something to listen to YouTube videos without putting my head phones on all the time. They don't sound good, I didn't expect them to. They sound OK and I can hear a voice just fine. For $10 they deliver what I need. My only complaint would be the heavy power cord coming out the back of one, the speaker weighs nothing so the cord will jerk it off the desk if not placed well.
customer_reviews.author: KevinW

customer_reviews.title: Good choice and very affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: Very good choice for a reliable speakers, especially it is from Logitech (comparing to those equivalents in this price range). Of course, I can't say it can beat any Bose desktop speakers around $100, but you definitely won't complain to its sound for PC multimedia use everyday. Be careful: The power strip is linked to the left channel speaker, and the 3.5mm audio strip is linked to the right channel speaker. Check your desktop / laptop and wall-mount power supply position. Package: Very simple. No color-print box. But the product is acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Wang

customer_reviews.title: For the price, they're fine!
customer_reviews.text: Let's be honest, these speakers are not anything amazing. They are super cheap and work as expected. I bought these for less than $10 as replacements for a broken computer speaker. The sound quality is nothing special but they work for basic music and video playing at a low-medium volume in front of my desktop computer. I'm totally happy with the purchase. If you're looking for awesome computer speakers these are not it...but for the basics, they're good.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Speakers
customer_reviews.text: We bought these as temporary speakers for a computer until we purchased wireless ones and for the money they are great. I always love most everything that logitech puts out. I am happy with the sound quality, but for any sound aficionados out there, it isn't going to be super amazing. I have slight hearing loss in one ear, so I do wish they could go louder, but having the headphone connection option on the speakers is a delight! If you are looking for an inexpensive, but quality speaker, this is the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: Maysona

customer_reviews.title: DIED way too early
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on June 5th - a little over 2 months ago. Now they suddenly died and I cannot get them to work. I am outraged at this schlocky product. Troubleshooter says they"re not plugged in," but they - -and all wires - - are. So, more money wasted on what I consider to be schlock products. Nothing to do, but buy more. Go AMZ!
customer_reviews.author: JMS

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: 4 star sound quality- for the money. Could use more bass- and I don't like much bass usually- but this needs some more. My hard-of-hearing elderly friend with no hearing aids prefers these to headphones for watching TV. Can plug headphones into the speakers if desired. One speaker has volume control knob- or adjust volume via your device (TV, pc, etc). If I insisted on another $9 pair of speakers- I'd buy again. If I wanted a little better sound quality- I'd try to see what a little more money buys.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B.

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Solid speakers. I have shopped with logitech before and have always had good experiences. These speakers are by no means anything great, but for less than 10 bucks you can't complain at all. I mainly use headphones, but sometimes I just want something to listen without having to use them, and these fit that task. Took a whole 5 seconds to hook up and do their job. If you want cheap speakers for a similar reason to mine then these are the way to go. If you mainly use your speakers when on the computer, or whatever you are buying these for then I suggest going a more expensive route. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Green

customer_reviews.title: An inexpensive solution for crappy TV sound
customer_reviews.text: My bedroom flat screen TV has horrible sound but I didn't want to invest in a sound bar. When I saw these, I snapped them up. Loved the price and I've had good luck in the past with LogiTech. They plug right into the TV's headphone jack and work perfectly for my needs by amplifying the mid-range. I could never properly hear the dialogue. The on-off/volume dial is on the right speaker with a 3.5 inch plug for headphones. They're small and cute. Don't hesitate to use these inexpensive PC speakers to solve your flat screen TV problems.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Good speakers
customer_reviews.text: These are good speakers for the cost. But whenever the wire from the computer to the speaker is touched the wrong way or move in a particular spot, it will buzz like mad until you fix the wire. Maybe it was mine, I'm not sure but it's still a good speaker. Logitech hasn't fail me yet and I have a keyboard, two mouses, a webcam, and a 2.1 speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson

customer_reviews.title: It's okay and functional.
customer_reviews.text: It works with my setup overall and I am satisfied with just that. Just a few small complaints: Firstly, the cord feels kinda cheap and is thinner than my liking. But this is okay in my space environment as I do not need to adjust and move these speakers often. Secondly, the volume is a bit lower than I expected from most regular speakers I use. For me, even at low volume, the quality seems kinda muffled and hard to hear. This can be solved by tinkering around with your volume mixer and such. I only bought this because it was cheap and for the price, it delivers its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Great price for the product. Brings “oontz” into my life.
customer_reviews.text: Well I bought this to use at work because my computer somehow doesn’t have speakers and my boss completely ignored my speaker request. I didn’t want to buy anything expensive as I’m probably going to leave them there for the next guy after and if I quit this job. Works great for the price! I’m happy I can finally listen to some “oontz oontz” while making designs. Definitely speeds up the work flow. I’m thinking of doing the other designer a favor and ordering him some speakers too (because his computer also doesn’t have speakers).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable quality and can’t believe this price
customer_reviews.text: I am super fussy when listening to music and did not expect I would be able to listen to music with these inexpensive speakers. I have much more expensive speakers with a subwoofer but wanted to just pick up a cheap pair of speakers to listen to voice mail messages left on my voip phone system. I was blown away at the unexpected quality. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CrossCountry

customer_reviews.title: Adequate
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes they don't work or have an annoying buzz and goes in and out. I bought them for my laptop which I only use for music. It makes the sounds but I should have paid more and got better quality speakers but they're adequate for the price.
customer_reviews.author: thehoss

customer_reviews.title: ~~Perfect for me~~
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for my money...I only listen to music occasionally and that is when someone sends me a You tube video. Small and compact and they fit the top of my desk nicely. Sound is good for my purposes and so easy for me to hook up. I am visually impaired but had no problems at all. Highly recommended. There was another update to these but I chose to get the older model.
customer_reviews.author: Serenity...

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: If you're a game or movie enthusiast and want these for personal use, I'd say pass. However, I got these speakers for my office at work because the training I do regularly is just too hard to hear sometimes. I got these because my job provided a set from the 90's (no joke). They're sleek and the sound is good enough for what I need them for. They will go haywire if your phone is nearby and a call or multiple texts come through.
customer_reviews.author: Keshia_518

customer_reviews.title: More than enough!
customer_reviews.text: My desktop’s speaker wasn’t the best so I had to get speaker but didn’t want to spend too much. These are perfect! Basic speakers just to listen to my professors lectures. The sound is perfect, I didn’t need anything too loud but they are loud if that’s what you’re looking for. They look and feel solid. There’s a headphone jack port on one of the speakers if you need that option too
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Ramirez- Ortega

customer_reviews.title: When all one requires to satisfy their need for audio is an inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: When all one requires to satisfy their need for audio is an inexpensive, smallish speaker with adequate sound, this Logitech S120 set seemed, from the online description and reviews, to fit those criteria. The Logitech S120 speakers have three long wires that connect to them, and they are 120v--not USB. Most disappointing is that the set I briefly owned developed a buzz that degraded sound quality to the point they were useless. Amazon took them back, of course. But lesson learned concerning the inexpensive Logitech S120 speakers. Bleh.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Ault

customer_reviews.title: Not loud enough
customer_reviews.text: Product is easy to set up, but sound is not louder than my laptop, so I don't see the added value. I bought a more expensive Bose speaker and that worked better.
customer_reviews.author: Jorrit

customer_reviews.title: Decent speaker
customer_reviews.text: This is really a decent speaker. It won't compete with all other high end speaker, mind you, but this produces decent sound for its size. Especially since I just want to listen to music while working on my basement. So rather than stuck with earbud or having more freedom having this speaker broadcasting sound from my phone.
customer_reviews.author: EBS

customer_reviews.title: Great little speakers!
customer_reviews.text: I was so upset when the speakers at my desktop computer died on me! I am on a limited income and knew that I couldn't spend very much, so I started looking. These speakers looked good, were a great price, and the reviews were very positive. I am very happy with them--the sound quality and volume control are much better than the original speakers! I also like that I can turn them off when I'm done to help save on a bit of electricity. I'm very happy! :-)
customer_reviews.author: teacherover40

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speakers for the price
customer_reviews.text: Really fantastic speakers for the sub-$10 price. They have a headphone jack, which is not very common and the main reason why I bought these over competitors. Sound quality is very good, but I may not be the best judge since I use them for work calls, Ted talks, and the occasional YouTube clip.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: I'm not trying to fill Carnegie Hall will 3D sound, I needed some speakers for my office area so that when I take Skype calls or watch YouTube videos on my laptop, I get better sound than the laptop speakers. For this purpose, I am blown away by the improvement... and the price was great too.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Walker

customer_reviews.title: Amazing speakers for the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my work computer that had no speakers and was tired of listening via earphones. These are amazing little speakers for the money. I wouldn't recommend them alone if you're expecting to use them for any quality entertainment, however, for just needing to hear audio they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Mr G

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory for the price
customer_reviews.text: My little laptop has disappointing volume. My hearing is not the greatest, but earphones are annoying and uncomfortable for me. I thought these little speakers would be a good solution. The volume is adequate but I am disappointed in the sound quality. But at this low price I can''t complain.
customer_reviews.author: GLT

customer_reviews.title: Quality set of affordable speakers
customer_reviews.text: Good audio quality(for the price). I use these in my office with the speakers on each side of my two monitor setup. The computer's output port does matter a little since the audio cord is only about 3 feet long. Overall I'm happy with this purchase and I'd buy them again. Only complaint is that they output an occasional static sound when I have them on but there's nothing playing through them.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my desk at work so they don't get a ton of use, nor are they ever turned up very loud either. Bought them about a month ago and just noticed that the left speaker is not putting out any sound now. Price was good but I guess you get what you pay for. UPDATE: Returned to Amazon for the same speaker. Set up the new speakers and within a week, the right speaker stopped working this time. Returning for something else this time.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Jackson

customer_reviews.title: I like them other than they fall over easily...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for non-blue tooth speakers that didn't take up much space, and these speakers met that criteria. The sound is good and they are attractive. However, because they are tall and slender with a small base, they tend to fall over easily, because of the pull of the cords. The base needs to have a heavier weight to keep them settled. While I'm mostly happy with them, I would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Chimes at Midnight Reviews

customer_reviews.title: nice little inexpensive speaker set
customer_reviews.text: Not the greatest quality. They are cheap inexpensive computer speakers. They are not stereo entertainment speakers. You get what you pay for and these are perfect for a nice set of Computer speakers with an on/off switch and volume control on the speaker itself. Would Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TA

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but effective speakers
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pair of cheap but good speakers for my work computer and that's exactly what I got. These aren't going to "wow" you with their performance compared to a setup with a sub-woofer and a multi-speaker set up, but for the price, you can't go wrong. Easy to setup and working well for me at my desk.
customer_reviews.author: I'm Here

customer_reviews.title: Static and buzzing
customer_reviews.text: I should have known better than to buy $13 speakers but since the reviews were pretty good, I decided to give them a shot. I just set them up and have already submitted a return order and will be return later today. There is constant static and a continuous buzzing sound. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: jlb11763

customer_reviews.title: You can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.text: I read some of the reviews for this product and they made me laugh. Yes the LED is bright. Guess what? A small piece of electrical tape solved that instantly. I spent $8.49 to add sound to my PC. It sounds much better than $8:49. There is no reason for me to complain. I am pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Foster

product_meta.title: Logitech S120 2.0 Stereo Speakers
product_meta.description: S-120 Speaker System enhances the acoustics to deliver less distortion with smooth audio. Compact size delivers high-quality audio. Design of speaker system also includes a convenient headphone jack, built-in knob for adjusting volume and analog stereo (3.5mm).
feature_bullets: Compact size that delivers high quality audio without using too much space
Convenient headphone jack for private listening, built in knob for easily adjusting volume

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars8,802 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
